content.text: Vince and Wendy share \$2000 in the ratio Vince: Wendy = 19:21
Calculate the amount of money that Vince receives
Wendy has \$265 to spend on some chairs
Work out the largest number of chairs she can buy
Wendy shares \$200 between her three children Jake, Karl and Lana
She gives \(27\%\) of the money to Jake and \(\frac{2}{5}\) of the money to Karl
Work out the amount of money she gives to Lana
Wendy invests \$500 at a rate of \(4\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the total amount of interest she receives at the end of 2 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest dollar
Reflect shape \(A\) in the line \(x = 0\). Label this image \(B\)
Rotate shape \(A\) through \(180^{\circ}\) about (2, 4). Label this image \(C\)
Enlarge shape \(A\) with scale factor 2 and centre (3, 7). Label this image \(E\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps shape \(D\) onto
Two shapes \(A\) and \(D\) are shown on the grid
The probability that the spinner lands on any of the six sides is equally likely
Write down the probability that the spinner lands on
Felix has a 12-sided spinner with the numbers 2, 4, 5, 7 and 9 written on it
It is equally likely to land on any side
The table shows the probability of the spinner landing on each number
The diagram of the spinner has been completed for the number 2
Complete the diagram for the numbers 4, 5, 7 and 9
Felix says that his spinner is more likely to land on a 2 than Jon's spinner
Complete the table by working out the sector angles for the numbers 7 and 9
Felix spins his 12-sided spinner 60 times and records the results
Explain why \(x\) must be less than 11
Write down an expression, in terms of \(x\), for the perimeter of the triangle
Give your answer in its simplest possible form
Write down an equation in terms of \(x\) and solve it
Work out the length of the shortest side of the triangle
The perimeter of the triangle is \(32\mathrm{cm}\)
In this question all the measurements are in centimetres
The diagram shows a triangle with sides of length \(2x + 3\) , \(11 - x\) and \(3x\)
Write down the number of crosses needed to draw Diagram 5
Write down, in terms of \(n\) , how many crosses are needed to draw Diagram \(n\)
Find the number of crosses needed to draw Diagram 20
The number of crosses in each Diagram forms a sequence
Write down the gradient of the line \(AB\)
Write down the equation of the line \(BC\) in the form \(y = mx + c\)
Give your answer in its simplest form
Explain what the word similar tells you about the triangles \(ABE\) and \(BCE.\)
Triangle \(ABC\) is drawn on a \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
How long does Toni wait at the caf before Poppy arrives?
Calculate Toni's average speed from home to the caf in kilometres per hour
At 10 50 Poppy walks to visit her friend Sasha
Sasha's home is \(5\mathrm{km}\) from Poppy's home
Poppy walks at the same speed as before
Complete the travel graph for Poppy
At 10 50 Toni starts to cycle home
At 10 55, when she has travelled half the distance home, her bicycle has a puncture. She then walks the rest of the way home at \(4.5\mathrm{km / h}\)
Complete the travel graph for Toni
Calculate the average speed for Toni's journey home from the caf
Poppy and Toni stay at the caf until 10.50
Poppy and Toni go to a caf which is \(3\mathrm{km}\) from their home
Poppy leaves home at 10:00 and walks
Toni leaves home at 10:10 and cycles
These journeys are shown on the travel graph
Who arrives at \(R\) first and by how many seconds?
Use trigonometry to calculate the size of the angle marked \(y\)
Calculate the area of the field in square kilometres
Give your answer in standard form
The diagram shows a rectangular field, \(PQRS\)
Bill and Said run from \(P\) to \(R\)
Bill runs along the sides \(PQ\) and \(QR\)
Calculate the volume of water the glass holds when it is filled to the top
Give the units of your answer
Water is poured into a number of these glasses from a jug containing 1.5 litres
Each glass has a horizontal line 2 cm from the top
Calculate how many of these glasses can be filled up to the line from the jug
A cylindrical drinking glass has radius \(3\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(8\mathrm{cm}\)
A cylindrical pipe has a circumference of \(16\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the diameter of the pipe
Work out the surface area of the cuboid
the mass, in kilograms, of one sphere,
the mass, in kilograms, of \(s\) spheres,
the mass, in grams, of \(s\) spheres
\(1\mathrm{m}^3\) of copper has a mass of \(m\) kg
The volume of one copper sphere is \(v \mathrm{~m}^3\)
